intro: Epilobium × confusilobum, commonly known as the hybrid willow herb, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It typically grows in moist, shady environments such as woodlands and stream banks. The plant has alternate, lance-shaped leaves that are often hairy, and it produces showy, pink to purple flowers in terminal clusters. Epilobium × confusilobum is part of the Onagraceae family, which includes other species like willow herbs and evening primroses. Its botanical features make it adaptable to a variety of wetland habitats.
